verses.name: Job 31:28
verses.text: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.

verses.name: Job 31:29
verses.text: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:

verses.name: Job 31:30
verses.text: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.

verses.name: Job 31:31
verses.text: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.

verses.name: Job 31:32
verses.text: The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveller.
